Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2024/0332 b) Date of Occurrence: 07/07/2024
c) Installation Details: Raptor Elite - AC-3332-280 at
Sector North Station
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Propulsion b) Date Component 13/07/2024
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Fuel Injection d) Main Assembly: Rack-Beta
e) Nomenclature: Fuel Injection Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: Modified
g) Part No.: PR-9952-X6 h) Sl No.: SN-4985-863
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 30/01/2021 l) Date of Removal: 10/07/2024
Pg No: 132 Ln No: 15 Pg No: 106 Ln No: 4
m) Manufacturing Agency: Summit Defense Solutions n) Date, Month & Year June 2018
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: No p) Whether under AMC No
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 1350 Hrs / 787 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Observation
b) Defect Observed: Fuel nozzle blockage. Anomaly detected during routine inspection.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Foreign object damage to critical surface
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Fuel Injection component. Physical
examination revealed signs of wear and degradation.
c) Remedial Measures Replace defective component with serviceable unit from approved stock
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Introduce protective coating to prevent environmental degradation
d) Attributable Code: U - Lapses on the part of User
Remarks: Complete defect analysis performed. Lessons learned documented.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Technical evaluation completed. Proposed preventive measures are appropriate and align with design intent.
Date: 22/07/2024 Authorized Signatory of Design: Gp Capt V.S. Pillai

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Component inspection records verified. All quality parameters were within acceptable limits during manufacturing.
Date: 24/07/2024 Signature: Air Cmde S.B. Rao
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
User feedback incorporated. Recommend enhanced crew training on system operation and limitations.
Date: 25/07/2024 Signature: Wg Cdr M.S. Reddy
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Regulatory quality requirements verified. Proposed actions meet airworthiness standards. Recommend approval.
Date: 27/07/2024 Signature: Sqn Ldr H.S. Bhatia
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Design aspects reviewed from certification authority perspective. Investigation is thorough and conclusions are sound.
Date: 31/07/2024 Signature: Dr. S.M. Kulkarni
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
